title: US announces $41 million COVID-19 assistance to India

title: J&J decides not to conduct trials in India for its COVID-19 vaccine - ET
description: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ.N) will not be undertaking local trials for its single-shot COVID-19 vaccine in India, the Economic Times reported on Tuesday, citing a company spokesperson.

title: Covid-19 India Updates: Less Than 40,000 Fresh Cases; Daily Fatalities Remain Below 1,000
description: Follow the second Covid-19 wave in India and the vaccination efforts here.

title: COVID-19: US lawmakers urge Biden administration to provide assistance to India
description: Describing India as an important friend and ally of the United States, top American lawmakers on Monday urged the Biden administration to help facilitate assistance for the country that has been gravely impacted by the deadly COVID-19 pandemic. India has recorded more than 30 million coronavirus cases and registered nearly 400,000 deaths due to the virus since the beginning of the pandemic last year.

title: India Reports 37,566 Fresh COVID-19 Cases, Total 907 Deaths in Last 24 Hours
description: Breaking News LIVE updates: Here is the live coverage of all breaking alerts and the latest updates from India and across the world. Stay tuned.

title: It’s been a ‘very traumatic experience’ for India after second COVID-19 wave: Journalist
description: Richa Sanwal, Mumbai-based Freelance Journalist and Documentary Filmmaker, joins Yahoo Finance to discuss India’s COVID-19 crisis and ambiguity in the country’s vaccination drive.

title: Finding support for India during its COVID-19 surge
description: Ashique KhudaBukhsh of Carnegie Mellon University's Language Technologies Institute led a team of researchers who used machine learning to identify supportive tweets from Pakistan during India's COVID crisis. In the throes of a public health crisis, words of hope can be welcome medicine.

title: India Made AstraZeneca's COVID-19 Vaccine Not Eligible For EU Travel, Seeks Resolution: Reuters
description: Serum Institute of India's (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla said he was trying to resolve EU travel problems facing Indians inoculated with SII's licensed version of AstraZeneca Plc's (NASDAQ: AZN) COVID-19 vaccine. "I have taken this up at the highest levels and hope to resolve this matter soon, both with regulators and at a diplomatic level with countries," Poonawalla said on Twitter. title: At least half of Mumbai's minors have COVID-19 antibodies - survey
description: At least half of Mumbai's under-18s have been exposed to COVID-19 and have antibodies against it, raising some hopes for levels of protection in that age group, a senior official said on Monday.

title: The Night the Oxygen Ran Out
description: A cascading series of failures, from the central government on down, left hospitals across India without medical oxygen, killing hundreds. One tragic night in Delhi shows how it happened.

title: Focus - Indian government promotes miracle cures for Covid-19
description: With the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic, alternative remedies and miracle cures have been flooding TV and social media in India. One of their strongest promoters is none other than the Indian Hindu n…

title: India, South Africa bid to ban COVID vaccine patents finds few takers in Latin America | DW | 28.06.2021
description: Latin America, which accounts for one-third of the total global COVID-19 deaths, is struggling to secure vaccines. The region's ambivalence toward a patent waiver for vaccines has left many perplexed.

title: India discussing ways to approve Pfizer, Moderna Covid-19 vaccines: Govt
description: At present, India is using three Covid-19 vaccines, Covaxin by Bharat Biotech, Covishield by Serum Institute of India (SII) and Russia's Sputnik V, for vaccinating people against the coronavirus disease.

title: T20 World Cup moved to UAE as India grapple with COVID-19
description: This year's Twenty20 World Cup will be moved to the United Arab Emirates (UAE) because to the COVID-19 situation in India and travel restrictions stemming from it, a top official of the Indian cricket board told Reuters on Monday.

title: Covid-19: A coronavirus-linked threat to children in India
description: Children who have fully recovered from Covid in India are battling a rare and dangerous infection.

title: India Has Undercounted Covid-19 Deaths by Hundreds of Thousands, Families and Experts Say
description: Statisticians and health experts estimate India’s Covid-19 death toll far exceeds one million, compared with the official count of more than 390,000—an undercount that undercuts the understanding of how big a threat new variants are.

title: PM Modi urges India to get COVID-19 shots amid Delta variant concerns
description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged people on Sunday to overcome their hesitancy and get COVID-19 vaccinations as soon as possible, as concerns grow about the highly infectious Delta variant being detected in some states.

title: Japan to ask athletes from India, others for more COVID-19 tests
description: Japan plans to ask Olympic athletes from India and five other countries hit hard by the highly infectious Delta variant of the coronavirus to have daily virus tests for seven days before leaving for the Games, a Japanese newspaper said on Sunday.

title: Japan to ask athletes from India, others for more COVID-19 tests
description: Japan plans to ask Olympic athletes from India and five other countries hit hard by the highly infectious Delta variant of the coronavirus to have daily virus tests for seven days before leaving for the Games, a Japanese newspaper said on Sunday.

title: India's doctors face Covid-19 toll with support from U.S. physicians - STAT
description: The dire situation in India is affecting thousands of U.S. doctors of Indian origin, who are struggling in different ways.

India's daily COVID-19 deaths rise by 1,183: health ministry
description: India reported on Saturday 48,698 new COVID-19 infections over the past 24 hours, data from the health ministry showed. Death toll in the country due to the virus increased by 1,183.

title: Arizonans provide COVID-19 relief to India in different ways
description: Indian Americans in Arizona are providing much needed resources to help India navigate a spike in COVID-19 cases. Organizations are sending food, money, oxygen tanks and mental health assistance to help Indians navigate the pandemic.

title: India's richest state shuts malls, cinemas as new variant spreads
description: India's richest state on Friday ordered malls and cinema halls to close as it scrambles to control a more transmissible variant of the coronavirus that has scuppered plans to ease lockdown measures.

title: DEFINE_ME

description: India reported on Thursday 54,069 new COVID-19 infections over the past 24 hours, data from the health ministry showed.

description: Managing a team of people in a time zone almost half a day ahead is at the very least inconvenient, if not completely…

title: India reports 50,848 new COVID-19 cases
description: India reported on Wednesday 50,848 new coronavirus infections over the past 24 hours, health ministry data showed.

title: Why pregnant women in India still are not eligible for COVID-19 vaccines
description: Government concerns about safety mean expecting mothers can't get shots. But some doctors are raising alarms about pregnant women's increased risk of severe disease and death.

title: Volunteers spread word on vaccines to India's poor after deadly COVID-19 surge
description: Volunteer groups are spreading the word about getting COVID-19 shots to India's poor and elderly, and ferrying some to vaccination centres in rickshaws and cabs following a surge in infections that killed hundreds of thousands.

title: India’s vaccinations hit record with free COVID shots
description: India gave out a record 7.5 million vaccine doses on Monday under a federal campaign to inoculate all adults for free after weeks of criticism that a chaotic rollout had worsened a second wave that killed hundreds of thousands.

title: India Hits Lowest Daily COVID-19 Tally In 3 Months
description: India confirmed its lowest daily coronavirus tally Monday in nearly three months, as it ramps up vaccinations and makes them free for all adults.

title: India’s Yoga Capital Hit by Downward-Facing Prospects Due to Covid-19
description: Schools close and teachers lose work as the foreign students who once flocked to a renowned learning center stop coming amid the pandemic.

title: As COVID-19 wave begins to flatten in India, new deadly illness poses a challenge
description: The country has reported more than 28,000 cases of a rare fungal infection, now increasingly seen in COVID-19​ patients and survivors.

title: Indian sprint legend Milkha Singh, 91, dies of Covid-19
description: Legendary Indian sprinter Milkha Singh has died at the age of 91 after a month-long battle with Covid-19, according to a family statement obtained by CNN affiliate News 18.

title: India should brace for third COVID-19 wave by Oct, say health experts
description: A third wave of coronavirus infections is likely to hit India by October, and although it will be better controlled than the latest outbreak the pandemic will remain a public health threat for at least another year, according to a Reuters poll of medical experts.

title: Taj Mahal reopens for tourists as India eases COVID-19 curbs
description: The Taj Mahal reopened to the public on Wednesday as India, still reeling from a disastrous second wave of the pandemic, pushes to lift restrictions in a bid to revitalise its economy.

title: Alarm rises in India over COVID-19 risks as crowds return to malls and rail stations
description: Having barely got over a devastating second wave of coronavirus infections, India was gripped with alarm on Tuesday over risks of a resurgence as crowds thronged railway stations and shopping malls a day after major cities relaxed curbs on movement.

title: Health experts say India missed early alarm, let deadly coronavirus variant spread
description: A veteran public health expert warned top Indian officials in early March that a new variant of the coronavirus was spreading quickly in a rural district in the heart of the country and that the outbreak required urgent attention.

title: Covid News: India’s Capital Will Ease Restrictions
description: U.S. states are reconsidering Klan-era anti-mask laws. Miami hosts the first major in-person business conference since the pandemic began.

title: Leading Experts Weigh In On Growing India’s Economy From Covid-19
description: Measures that regenerate investment, integrate cleantech solutions into the economy and promote inclusive growth can help drive India's recovery and long-term growth.

title: Indian pilots fight for compensation after colleagues die of Covid-19
description: The pilot had just completed a commercial flight from the United States to Covid-struck India when he received the news his colleague had died of the virus.

title: India's COVID-19 Outbreak Is Slowing Down
description: Death rates are high in India, but the rate of new cases is slowing down.

title: India Prepares for More Covid-19 Surges With Oxygen Plants and Hospital Beds
description: Cities and states are working to avoid a repeat of the humanitarian crisis that accompanied the devastating number of cases in the spring.

title: India cuts taxes on some COVID-19 medicines and equipment
description: India's government has cut taxes on some COVID-19 related medical equipment and medicines until the end of September, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Saturday.
